column4: http://tinyurl.com/43nv8m6  I've found some instructions that may help me.  However how can I move my old launchers from the ?old? gnome-panel?
I'm also a bit disorientated because currently nautilus is not installable, circular dependency.
do you have external repos or PPA's enabled
I do or did, but now I believe it's just oneiric.
they have probably installed packages that conflict and have created the broken dependency circle
Sure.  Though I'm looking at the output of apt-cache policy and it looks like all the offending packages came from oneiric.
which one ?
it's not supported
what additional repos did you have enabled ?
xorg edgers and upstream wine.
can't see them causing too much of a problem
why do you need it to not run networking ?
To save DHCP leases :)
Perhaps the built in network card can't be disabled in the bios and takes down the system when used.
why are you telling me this ?
what are you talking about ?
Why ask why, either you know the answer or you don't.  I've got answers to your questions.
I don't know what question you're asking
I was responding to stuk_gen gens question.
I can't agree there should be a way to disable networking on boot?
what ? I've just told him how to do it, he has the answer
I made that boot option up.
I told him how to do it
please don't do that
